tn.ref: the fourteenth day of the first month
tn.text: This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The fourteenth day is near the beginning of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: He placed the priests in their positions
tn.text: AT: "He told the priests which jobs to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: that Solomon son of David, king of Israel built
tn.text: AT: "the people built under the leadership of King Solomon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: your ancestral houses and your divisions
tn.text: AT: "your tribes and families"
Here "holy place" seems to refer to the general temple area. AT: "take your positions in the temple area."
This refers to the assigned work group for each Levite.
This refers to the various clans among the Levites. It seems that Levites were assigned to different work groups on the basis of the kind of work assigned to each clan or ancestral house.
See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
This is a baby goat.
"they prepared everything to perform the Passover."

tn.ref: the blood that they received from the Levites' hand
tn.text: "the blood that the Levites gave them"
AT: "they cooked"

tn.ref: they boiled them in pots, cauldrons, and pans
tn.text: AT: "they cooked them in water in many different pots"
(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:30:16|30:16]]
Everything associated with the preparation, sacrifice and worship of Yahweh during the passover can be referred to as a worship "service".
The first use of Israel reference the nation of Israel as a whole, but the second use of Israel refers specifically to the northern tribes of the kingdom of Israel
See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
AT: "restored proper worship to the temple"

tn.ref: What have I to do with you, king of Judah?
tn.text: AT: "You have no reason to attack me, King of Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I am not coming against you
tn.text: AT: "I am not fighting your kingdom." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: against the house with which I am making war
tn.text: AT: "against Babylon, against whom I am making war"
"fight with the army of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: that had come from the mouth of God
tn.text: "from God" or "that God had said to him"
